home.title: Home
home.descriptionA: Experienced full-stack software engineer & web developer with a demonstrated history of successfully leading development projects, from creating Java modifications for Minecraft to enhancing user experience in React.js and implementing secure REST APIs, while consistently employing agile methodologies and effective team collaboration.
home.descriptionB: Additionally, I am a geography content creator who has successfully leveraged the algorithms of multiple social media platforms, including Instagram, YouTube, and TikTok, to gain a respectable and engaging follower base.

personal_summary.title: Personal Summary
personal_summary.text: As an experienced Full Stack Software Developer based in Orlando, FL, I've demonstrated expertise in various technologies, from Java and C++ to React.js and Node.js. With a track record of spearheading projects, including the development of a Java modification program for Minecraft and a rewarding website for truck drivers, I've showcased leadership and innovation. My commitment to excellence is evident in my ability to streamline project management, solve complex problems, and deliver high-quality solutions that enhance user experience and drive organizational success.

entries.title: Full Stack Engineering
entries.text: I offer comprehensive solutions across both front-end and back-end development, ensuring seamless integration and functionality throughout the entire software stack.

entries.title: Web Development
entries.text: With expertise in HTML, CSS, and JavaScript frameworks like React.js, I craft visually appealing and user-friendly websites tailored to meet clients' specific needs and preferences.

entries.title: Game Development
entries.text: Leveraging languages such as Java and C++, I specialize in creating immersive gaming experiences, from concept and design to implementation and optimization, ensuring engaging gameplay and smooth performance.

connect_four.title: Connect Four
connect_four.text: Massive family of over 50+ implementations of the Connect Four game. This project includes implementations in over 30 different programming languages, including Java, C++, Python, JavaScript, and more. Additionally, it also includes over 20+ different frameworks or other formats, including React.js, Ruby on Rails, ASP.NET, and more.

interop.title: Interop Project
interop.text: A project that documents interoperability between different programming languages. Currently includes 15 different programming languages and 18 execution patterns.

excel_scripts.title: Microsoft Excel Spreadsheet Scripts (VBA)
excel_scripts.text: A useful library of VBA scripts for Microsoft Excel. This library is used to automate tasks in Excel spreadsheets.

minecraft_json_generator.title: Minecraft JSON Generator
minecraft_json_generator.text: Lightweight JSON generator built in Python for Minecraft resource & data packs. This project is used to generate JSON files for Minecraft mods, including custom items, blocks, and entities. Very useful for not only creating custom datapacks, but for mods as well via the mod name switching feature.

portfolio_website.title: Patrick Goodwin Portfolio Website
portfolio_website.text: This website is my personal portfolio website, built with React.js. This project is used to showcase my skills and projects, as well as to provide a platform for potential employers to contact me. This project is used to create a professional online presence.

lua_library.title: Patrick's Lua Script Library
lua_library.text: A useful library of Lua scripts for future reference. This library is used to automate tasks in Lua scripts, which can come in handy for performance-needy tasks, as Lua is usually a faster scripting language than both Python and Ruby.

neovim_config.title: Patrick's Neovim Config
neovim_config.text: My personal Neovim configuration. This project is used to configure Neovim to my liking, including custom keybindings, themes, and plugins. This project is used to make Neovim more user-friendly and efficient for my personal use.

python_maps.title: Patrick's Map Generator
python_maps.text: A United States county & state map generator, built with Python using the Geopandas and Matplotlib libraries. This project is used to generate maps of the United States, including county and state maps. This project is used to create custom maps for data visualization and analysis.

powershell_library.title: Patrick's PowerShell Script Library
powershell_library.text: A useful library of PowerShell scripts for future reference. Useful with the $profile script feature, I find this immensely helpful for automating tasks from the Windows terminal, as I am a frequent user of the Windows OS.

python_library.title: Patrick's Python Script Library
python_library.text: A useful library of Python scripts for future reference. Perhaps the most powerful of the script libraries due to Python's lightweight behavior & huge extension system.

ruby_library.title: Patrick's Ruby Script Library
ruby_library.text: A useful library of Ruby scripts for future reference. Useful for future Ruby on Rails developmental concepts.

pdf_builder.title: PDF Skills Builder
pdf_builder.text: A custom PDF builder built with Python via the Pdfkit and Jinja2 extensions, alongside HTML and JSON formatting. This project is used to generate PDF files from a list of skills and projects. This project can be used to create a custom PDF resume, which is very useful for job applications.

rijandel_encryption.title: Rijandel Encryption Project
rijandel_encryption.text: A family of 10+ implementations of the Rijandel encryption algorithm in 128, 192, and 256 bits. This project is used to demonstrate the Rijandel encryption algorithm in different programming languages. This project is used to create a family of implementations of the Rijandel encryption algorithm.

suprememc.title: SupremeMC Minecraft Mod
suprememc.text: A Minecraft Mod that adds custom tools, armor, mobs, blocks, dimensions, and many more features to the game. Built with Java versions 8-17 for select Minecraft versions between 1.16 and 1.20.

tiger_programming_language.title: Tiger Programming Language
tiger_programming_language.text: Custom programming language built in both Go & Rust to experiment with interpreter design and performance. Implemented on the portfolio website using Web Assembly.

tiger_tailgating_pros.title: Tiger Tailgating Pros Website
tiger_tailgating_pros.text: A website I built in 2024 for Tiger Tailgating Pros, a tailgating company in Clemson, SC. Built with React.js.

turing_machine.title: Turing Machine Project
turing_machine.text: Family of over 30+ implementations of the Turing Machine. Used to demonstrate turing completeness for different programming languages for research, especially for the Tiger Programming Language.

contact.title: Contact Me
contact.description: I respond to inquires from email, LinkedIn messages, and Instagram messages. I also will call back if my number is provided via resume or otherwise, though I prefer to keep my phone number private.

tiger.title: Tiger Language
tiger.description: The Tiger Programming Language is a custom programming language built in both Go & Rust to experiment with interpreter design and performance. Implemented on the portfolio website using Web Assembly. The Tiger Programming Language is a custom programming language built in both Go & Rust to experiment with interpreter design and performance. Implemented on the portfolio website using Web Assembly.
tiger.more_info1: For more information, refer to the README in the

tab.title: Patrick Goodwin
tab.description: Full Stack Software Engineer based in Central Florida
